definition: lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: That happened in the year 1636 when mania was reaching its peak.
sentences.chinese: 那一年是1636，郁金香交易的投机性也变本加厉。

sentences.english: In recent years, Mugabe has grown even more ruthless.
sentences.chinese: 在最近的几年中，穆加贝的残暴愈加变本加厉。

sentences.english: To spank a crying child just adds fuel to the fire.
sentences.chinese: 打一个正在哭的孩子，只能使他变本加厉，哭得更凶。

definition: lit. win an inch, want a foot (idiom); fig. not satisfied with small gains/give him an inch, and he'll want a mile

pinyin: yi1 er2 zai4 , zai4 er2 san1

definition: more than one can bear (idiom); at the end of one's patience/the last straw
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
see 恣意妄為|恣意妄为[zi4 yi4 wang4 wei2]
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
